readme.relevance: High - describes docs-mcp MCP server and tool ecosystem

claude_md.relevance: Critical - AI context for tool implementation patterns and planning workflow

planning_standard.relevance: Critical - defines section 5 task_id_system structure that needs workorder enhancement

key_patterns: Async function signatures for MCP tools
Type hints with pathlib.Path for file paths

helper_functions.pattern: Extract reusable logic to helper functions

similar_tools.name: gather_context
similar_tools.relevance: Creates context.json with metadata - needs workorder assignment

similar_tools.name: analyze_project_for_planning
similar_tools.relevance: Creates analysis.json with metadata - needs workorder preservation

similar_tools.name: create_plan
similar_tools.relevance: Creates plan.json - needs workorder embedding in section 5

similar_tools.name: generate_deliverables_template
similar_tools.relevance: Will create DELIVERABLES.md - needs workorder in header

key_patterns_to_follow: Read context.json before creating plan.json (check for existing workorder)

technical_constraints: Must be backward compatible with existing plans without workorders
Workorder ID format strictly enforced: WO-{FEATURE-NAME}-001
Cannot modify existing context/analysis/plan files (only new features)
Must work with async/await patterns for MCP tools

1_executive_summary.feature_overview: Automatically assign unique workorder IDs to all features using the MCP planning workflow. Every feature that invokes gather-context, analyze-for-planning, or create-plan gets a workorder ID (WO-{FEATURE-NAME}-001) that persists across the entire lifecycle and links all planning artifacts.
1_executive_summary.business_value: Provides automatic progress tracking, cross-file traceability, and unique identification for every planned feature without requiring any user configuration. Enables future reporting and analytics on feature delivery.
key_objectives: Automatic workorder assignment at first MCP tool invocation
Workorder persistence across context.json → analysis.json → plan.json → DELIVERABLES.md
Zero configuration - fully automatic for all features in planning workflow
Backward compatibility - existing plans continue working unchanged

success_metrics.functional: All new features using planning workflow get workorder IDs automatically
success_metrics.performance: Workorder assignment adds <50ms overhead per tool invocation
success_metrics.adoption: 100% of features using /gather-context or /create-plan have workorder tracking

complexity_estimate.justification: Requires modifications to 4 existing tools (gather_context, analyze_for_planning, create_plan, generate_deliverables_template) plus validation updates. Well-defined scope with clear requirements.

technical_risks.risk: Breaking existing workflows if workorder implementation has bugs
technical_risks.mitigation: Comprehensive testing with existing features, backward compatibility checks, gradual rollout

technical_risks.risk: Workorder ID format conflicts with existing naming conventions
technical_risks.mitigation: Use distinct WO- prefix, validate format strictly, document clearly

technical_risks.risk: Performance overhead from reading/writing workorder metadata
technical_risks.mitigation: Workorder operations are in-memory only, minimal file I/O overhead

technical_risks.risk: Validation failures for plans without workorders (backward compatibility)
technical_risks.mitigation: Make workorder validation optional, only check if workorder field exists

dependencies.name: Planning standard schema
dependencies.risk: Schema changes could break existing plans if not careful
dependencies.mitigation: Make workorder field optional in schema, validate only when present

dependencies.name: Deliverables generator feature
dependencies.risk: This feature may implement deliverables-generator before workorder tracking
dependencies.mitigation: Design workorder integration for deliverables as optional enhancement

2_risk_assessment.rollback_strategy: Workorder metadata is additive only - removing workorder fields from tools will not break existing functionality. Can disable workorder generation without affecting core planning workflow.

gather_context.modification_needed: Generate workorder ID, add to _metadata field in context.json

analyze_project_for_planning.current_behavior: Creates analysis.json, optionally saves to feature folder
analyze_project_for_planning.modification_needed: Read workorder from context.json if exists, preserve in analysis.json _metadata

create_plan.modification_needed: Read workorder from context/analysis, embed in section 5, assign to all tasks

generate_deliverables_template.current_behavior: Not yet implemented (part of deliverables-generator feature)
generate_deliverables_template.modification_needed: Read workorder from plan.json, include in DELIVERABLES.md header

plan_validator.modification_needed: Add workorder format validation, task reference validation

files_to_create.purpose: Workorder ID generation and validation helpers

files_to_modify.changes: Add workorder metadata structure to section 5
Document workorder assignment logic and workflow

F1.name: Automatic Workorder ID Generation
F1.description: Generate unique workorder IDs automatically when any MCP planning tool is invoked, using format WO-{FEATURE-NAME}-001
F1.user_story: As a developer using the planning workflow, I want every feature to automatically receive a unique workorder ID so I can track and reference features consistently without manual setup
acceptance_criteria: Workorder ID format is WO-{FEATURE-NAME}-001 (uppercase, hyphens preserved)
Feature name 'auth-system' generates 'WO-AUTH-SYSTEM-001'
Workorder generation is deterministic (same feature name = same workorder ID)
Helper function generate_workorder_id(feature_name) returns formatted ID
No user input required for workorder ID

F2.name: Workorder Assignment in gather_context
F2.description: Automatically assign workorder ID when gather_context tool is invoked and save to context.json _metadata
F2.user_story: As a developer running /gather-context, I want the tool to automatically assign a workorder ID to my feature so it's tracked from the very beginning of the planning workflow
acceptance_criteria: gather_context generates workorder ID on invocation
Workorder saved to context.json in _metadata.workorder_id field
Timestamp saved to _metadata.workorder_assigned_at (ISO 8601 format)
Tool name saved to _metadata.workorder_assigned_by ('gather_context')
Existing gather_context functionality unchanged (backward compatible)

F3.name: Workorder Preservation in analyze_project_for_planning
F3.description: Read existing workorder from context.json and preserve in analysis.json _metadata, or generate new workorder if context doesn't exist
F3.user_story: As a developer running /analyze-for-planning after /gather-context, I want the same workorder ID to carry forward to analysis.json so my feature has consistent tracking
acceptance_criteria: If context.json exists with workorder_id, read and preserve it
If context.json missing or no workorder_id, generate new workorder
Workorder saved to analysis.json in _metadata.workorder_id field
Analysis tool output includes workorder ID in response
No breaking changes to existing analyze_project_for_planning behavior

F4.name: Workorder Embedding in create_plan
F4.description: Read workorder from context/analysis and embed in plan.json section 5, assigning workorder_id to all tasks
F4.user_story: As a developer running /create-plan, I want the plan.json to include the workorder metadata and assign the workorder ID to all tasks so the implementation plan is fully tracked
acceptance_criteria: Read workorder from context.json or analysis.json (prefer context)
If no workorder found, generate new one
Embed workorder in section 5 (5_task_id_system.workorder object)
Workorder object includes: id, name, feature_dir fields
All tasks in plan.json have workorder_id field matching workorder.id
Plan validator checks workorder consistency

F5.name: Workorder Integration in Deliverables Template
F5.description: Read workorder from plan.json and include in DELIVERABLES.md header when generate_deliverables_template is invoked
F5.user_story: As a developer generating deliverables reports, I want the workorder ID prominently displayed in the header so I can easily identify which feature the deliverables represent
acceptance_criteria: Read workorder from plan.json section 5
Include workorder ID in DELIVERABLES.md header
Header format: '# DELIVERABLES - {WORKORDER_ID}'
Include workorder metadata: ID, feature name, status
Gracefully handle plans without workorder (backward compatibility)

F6.name: Workorder Validation in Plan Validator
F6.description: Validate workorder format, task references, and consistency when validating plan.json
F6.user_story: As a developer validating my implementation plan, I want the validator to check that workorder metadata is correct and all tasks reference the valid workorder so I catch errors early
acceptance_criteria: Validate workorder ID format matches ^WO-[A-Z0-9-]+-001$
Validate all tasks have workorder_id field (if workorder exists)
Validate all task workorder_id values match plan's workorder.id
Validate workorder metadata includes required fields: id, name, feature_dir
Validation is optional - only run if workorder field exists (backward compatible)

F1_tasks.description: Create generate_workorder_id() helper function in handler_helpers.py
Add unit tests for workorder ID generation with various feature names

F2_tasks.description: Update handle_gather_context to generate workorder ID on invocation
Add workorder_id, workorder_assigned_at, workorder_assigned_by to context.json _metadata
Update gather_context response to include workorder ID
Test gather_context with new and existing features

F3_tasks.description: Update handle_analyze_project_for_planning to read context.json for workorder
Generate new workorder if context missing or no workorder_id found
Test analyze_for_planning with and without prior context.json

F4_tasks.description: Update handle_create_plan to read workorder from context.json or analysis.json
Assign workorder_id to all tasks in plan.json
Update planning standard schema with workorder structure
Test create_plan with various workflow paths (with/without context, with/without analysis)

F5_tasks.description: Include workorder in DELIVERABLES.md header template
Add backward compatibility handling for plans without workorder

F6_tasks.description: Add workorder format validation (^WO-[A-Z0-9-]+-001$) to plan validator
Make workorder validation optional (only if workorder field exists)

phase_1.name: Core Workorder Infrastructure
phase_1.description: Build foundation: workorder ID generation and assignment in gather_context
deliverables: Updated gather_context tool with workorder assignment

phase_2.name: Workorder Persistence and Plan Integration
phase_2.description: Add workorder preservation in analyze and embedding in plan.json
deliverables: Updated create_plan with workorder embedding in section 5
All tasks in plan.json have workorder_id field

phase_3.name: Deliverables Integration and Validation
phase_3.description: Add workorder to deliverables template and implement validation
deliverables: Backward compatibility for plans without workorders

unit_tests.scope: Individual helper functions and workorder generation logic

test_cases.description: Test generate_workorder_id() with various feature names
Test workorder ID format validation regex

integration_tests.scope: Full workflow from gather-context to deliverables

test_scenarios.description: Test complete workflow: gather → analyze → plan → deliverables
steps: Verify analysis.json has same workorder ID
Verify plan.json section 5 has workorder, all tasks have workorder_id
Verify DELIVERABLES.md header includes workorder ID
test_scenarios.expected_outcome: Same workorder ID (WO-TEST-FEATURE-001) persists across all files

test_scenarios.description: Test workflow starting at create_plan (no prior context)
steps: Run create_plan for 'new-feature' without prior context/analysis
Verify all tasks have workorder_id field

test_scenarios.description: Test backward compatibility with existing plans
steps: Load existing plan.json without workorder field
test_scenarios.expected_outcome: Existing plans without workorder continue working

critical_paths: Test on real feature using full workflow (gather → analyze → plan → deliverables)
Test with existing features (fixing-gather-context) to ensure backward compatibility
Test validation errors (malformed workorder ID, missing task references)
Verify workorder appears correctly in generated DELIVERABLES.md

functional_requirements.measurement: Every feature using planning workflow gets unique workorder ID
functional_requirements.target: 100% of features have workorder after any MCP tool invocation

functional_requirements.measurement: Same workorder ID appears in context.json, analysis.json, plan.json, DELIVERABLES.md
Existing plans without workorders continue working
functional_requirements.target: Zero breaking changes for existing plans

functional_requirements.measurement: Plan validator correctly identifies workorder format errors
functional_requirements.target: 100% detection of malformed workorder IDs and missing task references

non_functional_requirements.measurement: CLAUDE.md, workflow guides, and code comments updated
Follows existing patterns (decorators, error handling, validation)
non_functional_requirements.target: Passes code review, all patterns followed

acceptance_gates: All unit tests pass (workorder ID generation, validation)
All integration tests pass (full workflow, backward compatibility)
Manual testing confirms workorder appears in all files
Validation correctly handles plans with and without workorders
Documentation updated in CLAUDE.md with workorder workflow
Changelog entry added documenting workorder tracking feature
